column4: a package requires python2.3 so i can't install it, is there any way to skip this dependency and see if it'll work?
Can't it use a version greater than 2.3?
probably, but it stops in installation
It's not in the Ubuntu repository. Where did you get this package from?
First you want to see what all packages this one depends on.
Short? Why's Poignant Guide to Ruby
There's no universal rule stating that books cannot be guides.
but there is a universal rule that states that books aren't short :p
Compared to some "bibles" I've seen, Why's guide is very, very short :)
i was thinking of something more like this: http://www.poromenos.org/tutorials/python :P
Though, if you wanted to get started (or rather, memorize basics) real quick, you could check out zenspider's "QuickRef", just google for "zenspider quickref"
